meanings.definition: A ground-dwelling Australian bird with a long tail that is known for its ability to mimic sounds from its environment.
meanings.sent1: The lyrebird sang a beautiful song in the forest.
meanings.sent2: I heard a lyrebird mimicking a car alarm in the bush.
meanings.sent3: The lyrebird decided to imitate the sound of a chainsaw, much to the surprise of the lumberjacks.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like a lyrebird, effortlessly copying the melodies she heard.
meanings.sent5: The lyrebird's mimicry was so accurate that even the other birds were fooled.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that imitates or copies the actions or speech of another.
meanings.sent1: She was a lyrebird, always repeating what others said.
meanings.sent2: The robot was like a lyrebird, copying every movement of the dancer.
meanings.sent3: The little boy acted like a lyrebird, echoing his sister's laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her friend was a lyrebird when it came to fashion, always wearing the same outfits.
meanings.sent5: The politician was a lyrebird, echoing the speeches of his mentor.
